org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.datastore

Class AbstractDataStore<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.datastore.AbstractDataStore<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element in the DataStore.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, DataStore<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMapBackedDataStore

    public abstract class AbstractDataStore<T>
extends Object
implements DataStore<T>
    AbstractDataStore is an abstract implementation of DataStore that manages the datastore transitions between the open and close state via close() method. All DataStore methods will first check to make sure that the datastore is not yet closed before delegating to a helper method that is implemented by subclasses. All DataStore methods are final so subclasses can not accidentally or maliciously override them to break the DataStore contract of throwing exceptions if already closed. For example, subclasses need to implement getImpl(String) to perform the actual act of getting a record out of the datastore. get(String) method is final and is implemented with the following pseudocode: 
      public final T get(String id) throws DataStoreException {
        throwExceptionIfClosed();
        return getImpl(id);
    }
    Author:
    dkatzel

        public final boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from interface: DataStore

      • iterator

        public final StreamingIterator<T> iterator()
                                    throws DataStoreException
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Create a new StreamingIterator which will iterate over all the records in this DataStore. The iteration order is guaranteed to match the iteration order by DataStore.idIterator(). The StreamingIterator is only valid while this DataStore is open. If the StreamingIterator is still not finished iterating when this DataStore is closed via Closeable.close(), then any calls to StreamingIterator.hasNext() or StreamingIterator.next() will throw DataStoreClosedException.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface DataStore<T>
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator instance; never null and will never contain any null elements; however the returned instance may be empty if DataStore.getNumberOfRecords() ==0.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem creating this iterator.

      • entryIterator

        public final StreamingIterator<DataStoreEntry<T>> entryIterator()
                                                         throws DataStoreException
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Create a new StreamingIterator which will iterate over all the DataStoreEntrys in this DataStore. The iteration order is guaranteed to match the iteration order by DataStore.idIterator(). The StreamingIterator is only valid while this DataStore is open. If the StreamingIterator is still not finished iterating when this DataStore is closed via Closeable.close(), then any calls to StreamingIterator.hasNext() or StreamingIterator.next() will throw DataStoreClosedException.
        Specified by:
        entryIterator in interface DataStore<T>
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator instance; never null and will never contain any null elements; however the returned instance may be empty if DataStore.getNumberOfRecords() ==0.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem creating this iterator.

      • containsImpl

        protected abstract boolean containsImpl(String id)
                                 throws DataStoreException
        Does this DataStore contain the given id. This method is delegated to by contains(String) after determining that the DataStore is still open.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to look for;
        Returns:
        true if the DataStore does contain this id; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem determining if the datastore contains the id.
        See Also:
        DataStore.contains(String)

      • getImpl

        protected abstract T getImpl(String id)
                      throws DataStoreException
        Get the record in this DataStore with the given id. This method is delegated to by get(String)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the object to fetch.
        Returns:
        the object being fetched, will be null if contains(id) is false.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem fetching the data from this DataStore.
        IllegalStateException - if this DataStore is closed.
        See Also:
        DataStore.get(String)

      • getNumberOfRecordsImpl

        protected abstract long getNumberOfRecordsImpl()
                                        throws DataStoreException
        Get the total number of objects in this DataStore. This method is delegated to by getNumberOfRecords().
        Returns:
        the number of objects in this DataStore; always >=0.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem fetching the data from this DataStore.
        IllegalStateException - if this DataStore is closed.
        See Also:
        DataStore.getNumberOfRecords()

      • idIteratorImpl

        protected abstract StreamingIterator<String> idIteratorImpl()
                                                     throws DataStoreException
        Create a new StreamingIterator which will iterate over the ids of all the records in this DataStore which preserves the contract of the Id iterator in DataStore.idIterator(). This method is delegated to by idIterator().
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator instance; never null and never contain any null elements, but could be empty if getNumberOfRecords() == 0.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem creating this iterator.
        IllegalStateException - if this DataStore is closed.
        See Also:
        DataStore.idIterator()

      • iteratorImpl

        protected abstract StreamingIterator<T> iteratorImpl()
                                              throws DataStoreException
        Create a new StreamingIterator which will iterate over all the records in this DataStore which preserves the contract of the iterator in DataStore.iterator(). This method is delegated to by iterator().
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator instance; never null and never contain any null elements, but could be empty if getNumberOfRecords() == 0.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem creating this iterator.
        IllegalStateException - if this DataStore is closed.
        See Also:
        DataStore.iterator()

      • entryIteratorImpl

        protected abstract StreamingIterator<DataStoreEntry<T>> entryIteratorImpl()
                                                                   throws DataStoreException
        Create a new StreamingIterator which will iterate over the DataStoreEntrys of all the records in this DataStore which preserves the contract of the Id iterator in DataStore.entryIterator(). This method is delegated to by idIterator().
        Returns:

        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem creating this iterator.
        IllegalStateException - if this DataStore is closed.
        See Also:
        DataStore.idIterator()
